q1.question: Robotics and automation engineer in Silesia — who is Michał Rapała?
q1.answer: A graduate of the **Silesian University of Technology** with over a decade of experience in engineering, **robotics, and industrial automation**. I live and work in Silesia, specializing in **production process simulations**, **industrial robot programming**, and building modern **web applications**.

q2.question: What is your experience in engineering, robotics, and IT?
q2.answer: I have over 10 years of professional experience. I specialize in **industrial engineering**, **robotics** and **automation**, as well as the **automotive** industry. In parallel, I develop **websites**, mobile applications, and implement solutions based on **Artificial Intelligence (AI)**.

q3.question: What was your most demanding project in the automotive industry?
q3.answer: My key achievement is automating the **body-in-white (BIW)** production process for the **Mercedes G-Class** at the factory in Graz. It was an engineering challenge because this legendary model had been hand-built for the last 40 years. Implementing **robotics and automation** into this process was a milestone for the production line.

q4.question: Web applications and websites for businesses — Silesia and all of Poland
q4.answer: Building **web applications** and **websites** for businesses with special focus on the **Silesian market**. From company landing pages to advanced business tools — every project built with a modern stack (**Next.js**, **React**) with emphasis on **performance and scalability**.

q5.question: Do you optimize websites for SEO?
q5.answer: Yes, and this section is a perfect example. It's technically tailored for **Google bots**, even though I personally don't enjoy talking about myself — I prefer to let my **completed projects** speak for me.

q6.question: What programming technologies do you use in your projects?
q6.answer: My tech stack focuses on modern, high-performance solutions. For websites and applications, I primarily use **React** and **Next.js**. For mobile apps, I work with **Flutter**. I'm also actively interested in implementing **AI** in code and process automation.

q7.question: How do you use artificial intelligence (AI) in your projects?
q7.answer: **AI** is both a passion and a work tool. I use **artificial intelligence** in engineering projects (**production process optimization**) and in application development — e.g., **Karton-na-leki**, a mobile app for managing a home medicine cabinet with **image recognition**.

meta.title: Robotics - Michał Rąpała | Robot Simulation & Programming
meta.description: Robotics engineer with over 10 years of experience in automotive projects. Process Simulate simulations and robot programming.

hero.title: Michał
hero.description: I am a robotics engineer with experience in automotive projects. I specialize in Process Simulate simulations and robot programming. I look for simple, effective solutions – also with the help of AI.

robotyka.marquee: Process Simulate ★ KUKA ★ ABB ★ Fanuc ★ BMW ★ VW ★ Volvo ★

about.title: About Me
about.text1: For over a decade, I have been working as a robotics engineer in the automotive industry. I specialize in preparing production process simulations in the Process Simulate environment, in accordance with the requirements of clients such as BMW, Volkswagen, Magna, JLR, and Volvo.
about.text2: For several years, I have been a project team leader in the simulation area – managing projects from the pre-engineering stage, coordinating tasks, client standards, and model quality. I have worked in both smaller teams (3–5 people) and larger structures (up to 10 people), responsible for the entire simulation area.
about.text3: I also gained experience in online programming of industrial robots – mainly KUKA (P1 certificate) and ABB – which allows me to better anticipate limitations and optimize processes in the design phase even before implementation.
about.text4: I value a practical approach, clear communication, and well-organized collaboration. In my work, I increasingly use AI-based tools that streamline data analysis, documentation preparation, and the automation of repetitive engineering tasks.

cta.title: Looking for an
cta.description: From BMW to Volkswagen – I have carried out simulations and robot programming for key players in the automotive industry. Different standards, one goal: an efficient process ready for implementation.

experience.heroDescription: Over a decade of experience in automating production processes.
experience.exp1Intro: As a robotics simulation engineer, I perform tasks related to the preparation, management, and optimization of projects in the engineering phase for the automotive industry. My responsibilities include:
experience.exp1Resp2: creating and managing simulations of robotic stations in Process Simulate according to client standards,
experience.exp1Resp3: offline programming of industrial robots (KUKA, ABB, Fanuc),
experience.exp1Resp4: selection of equipment and tools based on process assumptions,
experience.exp1Resp5: solving process problems and quality control of designed processes,
experience.exp1Resp6: communication with the client and suppliers – reporting progress, clarifying the scope of work.
experience.exp2Company: QT Swiss Engineering | May 2014 – April 2023 (over 10 years)
experience.exp2Desc: Responsible for various simulation projects and robot programming for automotive industry clients.
experience.ctaDescription: Check out my work for BMW, VW, Volvo and other key automotive industry players.
